title: I am disgusted by the mage support meta
body:
They aren't even "support", they are just unhealthy ranged champions with high base damage and low scaling, which makes them extremely strong in the bot lane where no one does damage without items and garbage in mid lane where champions can match your damage and out scale you.

I really want to see traditional supports like {{champion:16}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:40}} back in bot lane. And get these disgusting {{champion:63}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:90}} out of there.

~~BTW MYMU is a failure.~~

We're not talking about placing the Q so far behind the enemy that they can stand still to dodge, we're talking about putting them on the front edge.

Due to the shape of her Q you can only dodge in 3 of the 8 cardinal directions, if you're on the west of the ult you can dodge northwest, west or southwest. First it was "I hate tank supports!"

Then it was "I hate Shield supports!"

Then it was "I hate poke supports!"

Then it was "I hate sustain supports!"

Then it was "I hate burst supports!"

Then it was...

You see, the thing about the meta is that champs cycle in and out of popularity, so just because you don't like a certain style of support doesn't mean it is cancerous or doesn't belong in the game. Maybe you forget, but when {{champion:12}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:53}} etc. were strong, they were also considered overpowered and anti-fun to play against, just like {{champion:63}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:143}} are right now. That's not even mentioning the fact that half those champs at least have been meta within the past year or so

Blitzcrank for instance, considered a classic support by the majority of players, is downright obnoxious to play against. When he is good, he has an overly potent burst combo that leaves him exceptionally safe while hard CCing an enemy champ for multiple seconds while bringing a lone enemy into the waiting arms of his team. He decided team fights on a single hit or miss. This was far less healthy than having a bursty mage-like support (although I gotta say the OG mage "supports" like Morg and Annie are pretty bad too).

The problem with support as a role is that *utility has become too prolific within League's cast of champions, in tandem with the ever growing damage creep.* "Old school" supports are essentially irrelevant  in any iteration of the modern meta because you don't need a pure CC>Heal>Poke bot anymore, you can just find a team with the necessary supplemental abilities. That's why it works to have a support who's main contribution is bursty engage, because you've got multiple sources of DPS, plenty of frontline (for what its worth in the current nuclear war tier damage comps) at least two other champs with hard CC, etc.

Furthermore is the issue of gold. Supports are earning more gold than ever, and this is actually NOT GOOD for "traditional" supports, since their main selling point is *not needing gold because of what they bring in utility*. As I just stated, their standout utility isn't standout anymore, so being able to function without gold in a role which actually makes plenty of gold now is essentially obsolete. This leads to them either being useless because another champ that uses gold better is more potent throughout the game, or because these champs once given gold are too strong and subsequently nerfed to keep from being oppressive.

TL;DR: Classic supports were only relevant when their function was unique (high function and capability on a minimal budget, unique combination of traits that couldn't be found in other classes) and have at this point become irrelevant, thus leading to the cycle of support types tied to what is meta in the other roles.
